summary: WeatherVerse: weather app with imminent weather event alerts (rain/snow/storm/fog) and optional Android WebView bridge to trigger native notifications from web-detected events.
architectural_notes: Target deployment includes Android Studio native wrapper using WebView; Android side may handle real notification display via JS-Android bridge invoked from the web app.

existing_features.title: Update app branding so the name "WeatherVerse" is displayed consistently across the web app (HTML document title and in-app header title) for all locales.

Implement an imminent weather event alert system that detects if rain, snow, storm/thunderstorm, or fog is expected within approximately the next 1 hour for the selected location, and displays an in-app alert banner when triggered.

Add an optional JavaScript-to-Android WebView bridge integration that, when an imminent weather alert is detected, calls an Android-provided bridge function (if present) so the native Android layer can display a system notification.

Choose and apply a cohesive visual theme for WeatherVerse (colors, typography, and component styling) that fits a modern weather-alert dashboard, and use it consistently for the new alert banner and any new UI controls added for alerts/bridge behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement weather event alert system (e.g., rain/snow/storm/fog expected within ~1 hour) in the web app.
Add WebView JS-to-Android bridge hook so the web app can trigger Android-side native notifications when a weather alert is detected.
Set and display the app name as "WeatherVerse" everywhere in the app/UI branding.
